intro: Conoria cuspa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conoria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Conoria cuspa is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
